      • k_select

        public static int k_select(int[] arr,
                           int k)
        k-select function Returns the k-th smallest element in an array Runs in linear time, variant of Quicksort
        Parameters:
        arr - The input array
        k - The index of the element in the sorted array to return k starts at 0, so k_select(arr, 0) will return the minimum element.
        Returns:
        The k-th smallest element of the input array

      • pivot

        public static int pivot(int[] arr,
                        int pivot_index)
        pivot function puts all elements in an array that are less than an element to the left, and all elements greater than an element to the right
        Parameters:
        arr - The array to pivot
        pivot_index - The original index of the pivot element
        Returns:
        The index of the pivot element in the new array

      • swap

        public static void swap(int[] arr,
                        int a,
                        int b)
        swap function swaps two elements in an array in-place
        Parameters:
        arr - The array of elements
        a - The first index of an element to swap
        b - The second index of an element to swap

      • combine

        public static int[] combine(int[][] arrays)
        Combine function Combines a list of integer arrays into one long integer array
        Parameters:
        arrays - The list of integer arrays to combine
        Returns:
        A large int[] full of elements from the arrays
